sentences.sContent: The 23-year-old actor was greeted by screaming fans as he arrived for the Leicester Square premiere of his new film Remember Me.
sentences.sContent_eng: The 23-year-old actor was greeted by screaming fans as he arrived for the Leicester Square premiere of his new film Remember Me.
sentences.sCn: 这位23岁的年轻演员，在粉丝们的热情欢呼声中到达了莱斯雷特广场，今晚是他最新电影《记住我》的首映式。

sentences.sContent: The documentary premiered at the Jerusalem Film Festival.
sentences.sCn: 那部记录片在耶路撒冷电影节上首映。

sentences.sContent: Four astronauts visited for last week's premiere of the movie Space Station.
sentences.sCn: 四位宇航员到场参加了上个星期举行的电影《空间站》的首映式。

synos.tran: 首位的；初次的；女主角的

trans.tranCn: 首位的；初次的；女主角的

trans.tranOther: When a movie or show premieres or is premiered, it is shown to an audience for the first time
The premiere of a new play or movie is the first public performance of it
